Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI330201171
Licensee Group Organization: Highfields, Inc.
Licensee Designee: Brian Philson
Chief Administrator: Tyler Jones
Agency Name: HIGHFIELDS
Agency Address: 5123 OLD PLANK RD
ONONDAGA, MI 49264-9707
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2024
Capacity: 36
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
6/21/2023 2:30 PM Face to Face Special Investigation Initiation
6/22/2023 3:30 PM Phone Interview
6/28/2023 1:00 PM Video Conference Interview
7/17/2023 2:45 PM Phone Interview
7/18/2023 8:30 AM Video Conference MDHHS Pre-Dispositional
Conference – No Findings
7/27/2023 3:00 PM Phone Pre-Exit Conference
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was pushed and hit by a staff during an altercation.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 06/21/2023 and had no
additional information to provide.
Administrator 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
06/21/2023 during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the
facility. Safety planning was accomplished that included Staff A
not working one-on-one with any youth during the course of this
investigation.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 06/21/2023
during an unannounced face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
he had been placed in the program only seven days at that point.
Youth A recalled the incident in question. He stated Youth C had
been “running his mouth” at Youth A all day, and Youth A told him
to watch his mouth. Youth A stated he and Youth C had talked
about wanting to fight each other and Youth C met Youth A
outside the unit. Youth A recalled staff were able to get Youth C
back inside and he went into the staff office inside the unit. Youth
A cannot recall if Staff 1 or Staff 3 went in with him. Youth A stated
he sat on the couch outside the staff office intending to wait for
Youth C to come out. Youth A stated he heard Youth C “running
his mouth more” while in the staff office. Youth A believed staff did
not stop Youth C from saying inappropriate things to Youth A and
Youth B. He believed Staff 1 was laughing at him when Youth C
was on the phone with a family member on speaker. He also
recalled hearing Youth C’s brother make what he believed was a
death threat to Youth A. Youth A recalled staff, which he could not
identify, escorted Youth C to the main building on campus. Youth
A stated he and Youth B followed this group, intending to address
Youth C. Youth A stated he and Youth B had walked around to a
few of the houses to see if that’s where Youth C was and he
eventually saw Supervisor 2 near the main building. He stated he
initially hid behind a tree and he and Youth B then accessed entry
to the main building through a back door, which entered into the
kitchen area. Youth A stated the door was unlocked. He stated he
and Youth B eventually walked out and around the building to the
front entrance. Youth A stated there were staff who met him and
Youth B at the door of the main building and did not allow them
entry. Youth A recalled Youth B was holding the door open as he
and Youth A were speaking to staff. Youth A was asked which
staff these were, and he stated that in some combination Staff 1,
Supervisor 2 and Staff 3 were at the doorway. Youth A stated the
incident escalated when the door got shoved open further and
2

almost hit him. He stated Staff 1 fell into him and in the process of
doing so hit him with an open palm. Youth A stated he believed
she tripped, and it caused both of her hands to fall into his chest.
Youth A later clarified he would not really call this action a hit or a
slap as Staff 1 was losing her balance. He believed it was
unintentional and did not result in a hit to the face. Youth A
recalled Staff 1 having an open hand, and he believed that she
was going to hit him. Youth A recalled Staff 3 caught Staff 1’s
hand to prevent a hit. Youth A believed Staff 1 was angry and he
stated he had been antagonizing her throughout the night. He
believed she was taking Youth C side of the issue. Youth A stated
after this part of the incident he went back to his unit with Youth B.
The rest of the night, he sat up and watched TV with Youth B
when law enforcement arrived, and he was eventually taken into
police custody for the rest of the night.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 06/22/2023. He stated he was not on campus in person for
the incident in question but did participate in some of the work
responding to it over the phone. He stated he provided Youth A
transportation back to the facility after he was released from law
enforcement custody the following day. Supervisor 1 stated Youth
A had recounted the incident as more of a struggle and not
punching or hitting. Youth A did state to Supervisor 1 he was
shoved out of the building when trying to gain access to get to
Youth C.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
06/22/2023. Staff 2 was present with Staff 1 for this interview as a
requested support person. Staff 1 recalled working with Youth A
and Youth B during the incident in question. She stated the entire
incident started with Youth A and Youth B arguing with Youth C.
Staff 1 stated the strategy the staff took once the three youth were
further escalated was to have Youth C move into the office within
the unit. He had requested to make a phone call at that point.
Staff 1 recalled Youth C was on the phone for about an hour on
and off and Youth A and Youth B sat outside the office and
continued to say threatening things toward Youth C. Staff 1 stated
she, nor Supervisor 2 or Staff 3 that were in the office said
anything to Youth A and Youth B during this part of the
incident. Staff 1 stated she called Supervisor 1 for direction and
was instructed to move Youth C to the main administration
building on campus to separate the youth further. She stated she
took Youth C to the main office, and she heard over the radio that
Youth A and Youth B had begun to AWOL around campus looking
for Youth C. Staff 1 stated she was in the back of the building
3

when she heard a commotion at the front door and went up to the
front. When she got up front, Staff 4 held the front door open with
Youth A and Youth B outside. Staff 1 believed Youth A was trying
to pull the door open as Staff 4 came inside. Staff 1 stated she
stepped in front of Staff 4 as Staff 4 entered, making her the
closest staff to Youth A and Youth B outside the door. Staff 1
stated she attempted to close the door and in doing so Youth A
pushed her backwards in her upper chest area. Staff 1 stated this
caused her to move backwards, but she did not fall all the way to
the ground. Staff 1 believed Supervisor 2 was the staff that was
able to close the door as he had stepped in front of Staff 1. Staff 1
stated she did not have any contact with Youth B or Youth A after
this point in time. Staff 1 denied pushing, punching, or hitting
Youth A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 06/28/2023 over video
conference with DHHS Worker 1. She confirmed she was
involved in the incident in question. Supervisor 2 recalled Youth A
and Youth B were “getting into it” with Youth C. Supervisor 2
stated she was present in the unit when Youth C was in the office
inside the unit during the time Youth A alleged inappropriate
comments were made by Youth C and staff. Supervisor 2 did not
hear any laughing or mocking of any of the youth from staff during
this part of the incident. Supervisor 2 was asked again about any
yelling or cussing that she had heard, and she confirmed that she
had only heard that coming from Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
and it was only directed at each other. As the incident escalated
Supervisor 2 recalled Youth A and Youth B AWOL’ed around
campus to follow Staff 1 who were moving Youth C to the main
building. Supervisor 2 stated this was being done to defuse the
entire situation and separate the youth temporarily. Supervisor 2
recalled Youth A and Youth B broke down a door to the dining hall
in the basement to find Youth C. They eventually came around to
the front door and encountered Supervisor 2. Supervisor 2 told
Youth A and Youth B they could not come into the building, and
they needed to return to their unit because it was late at night. She
recalled one of the youths, she couldn’t remember which one, had
their hands on the door as she tried to shut it. Supervisor 2
recalled seeing Youth A push Staff 1 in the process. Youth A
used both hands and pushed Staff 1 as Supervisor 2 was trying to
shut the door and move outside with the two youth. Supervisor 2
did not believe Staff 1 fell to the ground. Supervisor 2 stated Staff
4 was also trying to block the youth from entering the doorway,
and stated she did not see Staff 4 put her hands on either of the
youth. Supervisor 2 stated she got the door shut and was outside
of the building, with Staff 1 on the inside. Supervisor 2 stated she
4

then attempted to talk Youth A and Youth B into going back to the
unit more and was eventually successful. She also confirmed that
no staff put their hands on Youth B or Youth A until law-
enforcement did so later in the night.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 06/28/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 over
video conference. He stated the entire incident all started around
9:30 or 10 PM. Staff 3 stated he did not know why Youth A and
Youth B were so upset with Youth C. Staff 3 stated Staff 1, nor
any other staff, were talking out of the room towards anyone when
they were in the office with Youth C while still inside the unit. Staff
3 stated he was not directly involved in the movement of Youth C
from the unit to the other building but witnessed the course of
events as they occurred. He stated Youth A and Youth B ran out
of the unit in an attempt to follow staff, and Staff 3 followed in
pursuit to attempt to keep line of sight. Staff 3 stated it was hard to
follow the two youths because it was so dark. He stated he
eventually saw them running around the main building after they
had broken into a door in the basement. Staff 3 stated this took
about an hour from start to finish. Staff 3 stated he witnessed part
of the interaction at the front door of the building from a distance.
Staff 3 recalled Youth A and Youth B were yelling past Staff 1 that
were present in an attempt to get to Youth C. Staff 3 saw Youth A
push Staff 1. Staff 3 stated he was now closer to the incident, and
he reached out to attempt to pull Staff 1 inside. Staff 3 stated he
did this because he believed Youth A could hurt Staff 1 because
of his size. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 never put her hands on Youth A
and she did not fall to the ground, nor did Youth A or Youth B. He
could not recall Youth A saying a whole lot after this part of the
incident. Staff 3 believed he heard Staff 1 remark that she kind of
hurt her upper chest area because of how Youth A pushed her.
Youth B was interviewed on 06/28/2023 over video conference
with DHHS Worker 1. He stated the entire incident occurred
because Youth C was saying inappropriate things to Youth A and
himself. As there were verbal arguments occurring, Youth B
recalled Youth C being moved into the main office in his unit. He
was there with Staff 1, Staff 3, and Supervisor 2. Youth B
overheard talking in the phone calls occurring. Youth B stated
Youth C was eventually taken outside by Staff 1 after he and
Youth A had not backed down or calmed down. Youth B stated
Youth C was eventually moved up to the main office on campus
and he and Youth A followed to continue to address him. Youth B
recalled kicking the door into the basement of the building in an
attempt to find Youth C. They then went up to the front entrance of
the building. Youth B stated he was holding the door at one point
5

and believed Staff 1 tried to push him off the door as well as
attempt to punch him. Youth B stated Youth A pushed Staff 1 back
and Staff 1 punched Youth A in the face with a closed fist. Youth B
stated he did not recall seeing any marks on Youth A’s face after.
He also recalled Staff 1‘s hip bumping into Youth A and Youth B
when they were jostling at the door. Youth B believed Youth A
bumped or nudged into her, but she did not fall over. Youth B
stated she fell backwards into the second interior door and tripped
over another staff’s foot. Youth B confirmed the other two staff
involved were Supervisor 2 and Staff 3. He stated they were not
able to get inside of the building and went back to the house
afterwards until law-enforcement came.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 07/17/2023 over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she was working the night in question. Staff
4 stated she happened to be up in the main office building and not
in the unit as the incident unfolded. Staff 4 stated she was called
to the unit at some point and ended up speaking with Youth A and
Youth B. She recalled Youth A and Youth B stated Youth C was
“talking smack” to them and they needed to get even. At this point
Youth C was taken up to the main part of the building. Staff 4
stated she called Supervisor 1. Youth B walked out of the unit in
an attempt to follow Youth C. She stated she stayed in the unit
with the other youth to provide supervision until Supervisor 2
came to get her. She went up to the main building. She stated she
saw Youth A and Youth B sitting at a picnic table outside the
building, and as she approached, they attempted to get into the
building through the front door. Staff 4 told them to move, and they
could not be there right now as she tried to get into the building.
Staff 4 stated she entered the doorway, but Youth A and Youth B
held the door open. Staff 4 recalled Staff 1 stepped out in front of
her in between her and Youth A and Youth B. Staff 4 stated she
could not 100% recall what occurred at that point but knew there
was a brief physical struggle as Youth A and Youth B attempted to
get inside the building.
DHHS Worker 1 confirmed during a video conference meeting on
07/18/2023 that there are no findings to their investigation.
Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed. She had one prior
disciplinary action regarding inappropriate conversations
with another staff while on shift from January 2023. Staff 1
is also certified in the facility’s restraint model, CPI, until
05/19/2024.
6

• Incident report dated 06/19/2023 authored by Staff 3
describing the incident in question. This documentation
states Youth A and Youth B left their unit and went up to
the main building on campus to find Youth C and were not
allowed access to the building. The incident report stated
Youth A and Youth B banged and kicked on the doors of
the building and attempted to push Staff 1 as they tried to
gain access to the building.
o An additional incident report dated 06/20/2023 and
signed off on by Administrator 1 was also reviewed
and held consistent information as the previously
outlined documentation.
• Police report from the Ingham County Sheriff's Office
describing the interaction between Youth A and law
enforcement on 06/19/2023 was reviewed. Law
enforcement interacted with Staff 1 and Supervisor 2 and
were informed by them that Youth A and Youth B had
attempted to kick in the front door to the main building on
campus and in the process had injured Staff 1.
• Video footage was provided by Law Enforcement that
contained body cam footage of interactions with Staff 1,
Youth A and Youth B on 06/19/2023 at approximately 2:30
am. This occurred after Youth A and Youth B returned to
the unit and Youth A was subsequently arrested. This
footage contained an interview with Staff 1 that was
consistent with interviews contained in this report.
Photographs of injuries to Youth A taken on 06/21/2023
were reviewed. Youth A showed abrasions on his skin
underneath his right elbow, on his right wrist and on the
inside of his right wrist. Youth A was not able to say for
certain that these injuries stemmed from the incident in
question.
Analysis Through interviews with staff and youth, documentation and video
reviewed there was no evidence that Youth A had been pushed or
hit by Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
08/01/2023

Tyler Armstrong
Licensing Consultant Date
